option.value: {"/home/vaidiksoni/IdeaProjects/APIAutomationFramework":"{\"/output/postRequestUsingExternalFileResponse.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON object representing a person\\u0027s information, including their name, email, jobs, marks, and favorite foods. There are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file serves as a data structure to store and organize the person\\u0027s personal and academic details.\",\"/src/test/resources/jsonSchema/employeeSchema.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON schema definition, which defines the structure and validation rules for a JSON object. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the properties and requirements for a JSON object with the following structure:\\n\\n1. `id`: a string that uniquely identifies the object\\n2. `first_name`: the first name of the person\\n3. `last_name`: the last name of the person\\n4. `email`: the email address of the person\\n5. `jobs`: an array of strings representing the person\\u0027s jobs\\n6. `marks`: an array of objects, each containing the person\\u0027s Hindi and English marks\\n7. `favFoods`: an object containing the person\\u0027s favorite breakfast, lunch, and dinner foods\\n\\nThe schema also defines the required properties for the object and the data types for each property.\",\"/output/response.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON object representing a person\\u0027s information, including their name, email, jobs, marks, and favorite foods. There are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file serves as a data structure to store and organize the person\\u0027s personal and academic details.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/requestbuilder/RequestBuilders.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `RequestBuilders` that provides methods to build request specifications for different HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) using the Rest Assured library.\\n\\n`RequestBuilders`: A utility class that provides methods to build request specifications for different HTTP methods.\\n\\n`buildRequestForGetCall()`: Builds a request specification for a GET call, including the base URI and logging all requests.\\n\\n`buildRequestForPostCall()`: Builds a request specification for a POST call, including the base URI, logging all requests, and setting the content type to JSON.\\n\\n`buildRequestForPutCall()`: Builds a request specification for a PUT call, including the base URI, logging all requests, and setting the content type to JSON.\\n\\n`buildRequestForDeleteCall()`: Builds a request specification for a DELETE call, including the base URI and logging all requests.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/reports/ExtentLogger.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `ExtentLogger` that provides static methods for logging different types of messages using `ExtentManager`.\\n\\n`ExtentLogger`: A utility class that provides static methods for logging different types of messages using `ExtentManager`.\\n\\n`ExtentLogger.pass(String passMessage)`: Logs a pass message using `ExtentManager`.\\n\\n`ExtentLogger.fail(String failMessage)`: Logs a fail message using `ExtentManager`.\\n\\n`ExtentLogger.skip(String skipMessage)`: Logs a skip message using `ExtentManager`.\\n\\n`ExtentLogger.info(String infoMessage)`: Logs an info message using `ExtentManager`.\\n\\n`ExtentLogger.logResponse(String message)`: Logs a response message using `ExtentManager`.\\n\\n`ExtentLogger.logRequest(RequestSpecification requestSpecification)`: Logs a request specification using `ExtentManager`.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/reports/FrameWorkLogger.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `FrameWorkLogger`, which provides methods for logging different types of messages using the ExtentManager class.\\n\\n`FrameWorkLogger`: The `FrameWorkLogger` class provides methods for logging different types of messages using ExtentManager, and it uses Consumers to define the actions to be performed for each log type.\\n\\n`log(LogType, String)`: This method logs a message of the specified log type using the associated consumer.\",\"/src/test/java/com/learning/tests/GetTests.java\":\"This file contains a single class `GetTests` and two functions within it.\\n\\n`GetTests`: This class contains test cases for making GET requests to the \\\"/employees\\\" and \\\"/employees/{id}\\\" endpoints.\\n\\n`getEmployeesDetails()`: This function sends a GET request to the \\\"/employees\\\" endpoint and verifies the response status code, content type, and the size of the employee array.\\n\\n`getEmployeeDetails()`: This function sends a GET request to the \\\"/employees/{id}\\\" endpoint, where the `id` is set to 2, and verifies the response status code, content type, the first name of the employee, and the presence of the `last_name` field in the JSON response.\",\"/src/test/resources/jsonFiles/request.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON object representing a user\\u0027s information, including their name, email, jobs, marks, and favorite foods. There are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file serves as a data structure to store and organize the user\\u0027s personal and academic information.\",\"/src/test/java/com/learning/tests/PostTest.java\":\"This file contains a single class `PostTest` and two functions `postCallTests()` and `postRequestUsingExternalFile(Method method)`.\\n\\n`PostTest`: This class contains tests for POST API calls, including creating an employee using a POJO and making a POST request using an external JSON file.\\n\\n`postCallTests()`: This function creates an employee using a POJO, sends a POST request, and asserts that the response has a status code of 201.\\n\\n`postRequestUsingExternalFile(Method method)`: This function reads a JSON request from an external file, replaces some placeholders with random values, sends a POST request, saves the response to an external file, and validates the JSON schema of the response.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/annotation/FrameWorkAnnotation.java\":\"This file defines a custom annotation called `FrameWorkAnnotation` that can be applied to methods. The annotation has two attributes: `author` and `category`, which can be used to provide metadata about the annotated method.\\n\\n`FrameWorkAnnotation`: An annotation that can be used to provide metadata about a method, including the author and category of the method.\\n\\n`author()`: An attribute of the `FrameWorkAnnotation` that specifies the author(s) of the annotated method, with a default value of \\\"Vaidik\\\".\\n\\n`category()`: An attribute of the `FrameWorkAnnotation` that specifies the category of the annotated method, with a default value of \\\"Regression\\\".\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/utils/RandomUtils.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `RandomUtils` that provides methods to generate random data for a business application.\\n\\n`RandomUtils`: A utility class that provides methods to generate random data for a business application.\\n\\n`getId()`: Generates a random integer between 100 and 1000 to be used as an identifier.\\n\\n`getFirstName()`: Generates a random first name in lowercase.\\n\\n`getLastName()`: Generates a random last name in lowercase.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/enums/PropertiesType.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines an enum called `PropertiesType` that contains three enum constants: `BASEURL`, `OVERRIDEREPORTS`, and `TESTCASEAUTHOR`. This enum is likely used to represent different types of properties or configuration settings in the application.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/utils/FakerUtils.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes, but it does contain the following functions:\\n\\n`FakerUtils`: This is a utility class that provides methods to generate random data using the Faker library.\\n\\n`getNumber(int startvalue, int endvalue)`: This function generates a random integer between the specified start and end values.\\n\\n`getFirstName()`: This function generates a random first name.\\n\\n`getLastName()`: This function generates a random last name.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a set of utility functions that can be used to generate random data, such as names and numbers, for use in testing or other applications.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/reports/ExtentReport.java\":\"This file contains the `ExtentReport` class and several functions related to generating and managing Extent Reports for test automation.\\n\\n`ExtentReport`: Provides methods for initializing, tearing down, and creating ExtentReports.\\n\\n`initReports()`: Initializes the ExtentReports instance, creates ExtentSparkReporter for the main report and failed test report, sets the theme, report name, and document title, attaches the reporters to the extentReports instance, and sets system information for the reports.\\n\\n`tearDownReport()`: Flushes the extentReports instance, unloads the ExtentManager, and opens the main report in the default browser.\\n\\n`createTest(String testCaseName)`: Creates a test with the given test case name and assigns author and category to the test based on the property values.\\n\\n`addAuthor(String[] authors)`: Adds authors to the current Extent Report test.\\n\\n`addCategory(String[] categories)`: Adds categories to the current Extent Report test.\",\"/src/test/java/com/learning/tests/DataProviderTest.java\":\"This file appears to be a test class for a data provider in a REST API testing framework. It does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`getData()`: This function provides a data set for the test method to use.\\n\\n`getEmployeeDetails(int id, String lastname)`: This test method sends a GET request to the `/employees/{id}` endpoint, verifies the response status code and content type, and checks if the response JSON contains the `last_name` key. It also logs the response using the `ExtentLogger` class.\\n\\nThe file also includes some annotations, such as `@Listeners(TestListeners.class)` and `@FrameWorkAnnotation(author \\u003d {\\\"Vaidik\\\"}, category \\u003d {\\\"Regression\\\"})`, which are likely used for test execution and reporting purposes.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/reports/ExtentManager.java\":\"This file contains a utility class called `ExtentManager` that manages the `ExtentTest` instances using `ThreadLocal`.\\n\\n`ExtentManager`: A utility class for managing the `ExtentTest` instances using `ThreadLocal`.\\n\\n`ExtentManager()`: A private constructor to prevent instantiation of the `ExtentManager` class.\\n\\n`getExtentTest()`: Returns the `ExtentTest` instance associated with the current thread.\\n\\n`setExtentTest(ExtentTest extentTest)`: Sets the `ExtentTest` instance for the current thread.\\n\\n`unLoad()`: Removes the `ExtentTest` instance associated with the current thread.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/constants/FrameworkConstants.java\":\"This file contains a class named `FrameworkConstants` that holds various constant values used throughout the application.\\n\\n`FrameworkConstants`: A class that holds various constant values used in the application, such as file paths, report paths, and other configuration settings.\\n\\n`getEXTENTREPORTPATH()`: This function checks the value of the \\\"overrideReports\\\" property and generates a dynamic file path for the Extent Report based on the current date and time, or returns a default file path if the \\\"overrideReports\\\" property is not set to \\\"yes\\\".\",\"/src/test/java/com/learning/tests/PutTests.java\":\"This file contains a single test class for a PUT request to update an employee.\\n\\n`PutTests`: A test class that contains a single test method to update an employee.\\n\\n`updateEmployee()`: A test method that creates a new employee, sends a PUT request to update the employee, and asserts that the response status code is 200.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/utils/ApiUtils.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `ApiUtils` with two static methods:\\n\\n`ApiUtils`: A utility class that provides methods for reading JSON files and storing API responses as JSON files.\\n\\n`readJsonAndGetAsString`: Reads the contents of a JSON file and returns it as a string.\\n\\n`storeStringResponseAsJsonFile`: Stores the response from an API call as a JSON file.\",\"/src/test/java/com/learning/tests/BaseTest.java\":\"This file contains a single class `BaseTest` and two commented-out functions `seUpSuite()` and `tearDownSuit()`.\\n\\n`BaseTest`: A base class that sets up and tears down the test suite.\\n\\n`seUpSuite()`: Initializes the Extent Report before the test suite is executed.\\n\\n`tearDownSuit()`: Tears down the Extent Report after the test suite is executed.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a base class for other test classes to inherit from, which sets up and tears down the Extent Report for the entire test suite.\",\"/reports/failed-index.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML document that displays a report for a REST API automation test. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file provides a dashboard view with information about the test run, including the start and end times, the number of tests passed and failed, and a timeline of the test execution. The report is generated using the Extent Framework, a popular reporting tool for automation testing.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/utils/PropertyUtils.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `PropertyUtils` that is responsible for managing properties loaded from a configuration file. It follows the Singleton pattern to ensure that properties are loaded only once during class initialization.\\n\\n`PropertyUtils`: A utility class for managing properties loaded from a configuration file, following the Singleton pattern.\\n\\n`PropertyUtils()`: A private constructor to prevent instantiation of the `PropertyUtils` class.\\n\\n`getValues(PropertiesType key)`: A public method to retrieve property values based on the provided `PropertiesType` key.\\n\\n`getPropertyValue(String key)`: A public synchronized method to retrieve property values based on the provided key.\",\"/src/test/java/com/learning/tests/DeleteRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class and a single function.\\n\\n`DeleteRequest`: This class contains a test method for deleting an employee from the system.\\n\\n`deleteEmployee()`: This function sends a DELETE request to the `/employees/{id}` endpoint with the path parameter `id` set to `4`, and logs a success message using the `ExtentLogger` class.\\n\\nThe file appears to be a test class for a DELETE request in a REST API testing framework.\",\"/extent-test-output/Index.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML document that displays the results of a REST API automation test. It does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it provides a dashboard view with information about the test run, including the start and end times, the number of tests passed and failed, and a timeline of the test execution. The file also includes sections for displaying information about the author, the categories (tags) associated with the tests, and the system/environment details.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/pojo/Employee.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `Employee`, which is a POJO (Plain Old Java Object) class.\\n\\n`Employee`: A class that represents an employee with an ID, first name, and last name.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but it uses the Lombok library to generate the necessary boilerplate code, such as the constructor, getters, and setters, for the `Employee` class.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/enums/ConfigProperties.java\":\"This file contains a single enum, `ConfigProperties`, which serves as a container for a set of configuration properties.\\n\\n`ConfigProperties`: An enum that defines a set of configuration properties.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/enums/LogType.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines an enum called `LogType` that represents different types of logs that can be used in a logging system. The enum has the following values:\\n\\n`PASS`: Represents a successful test case.\\n`FAIL`: Represents a failed test case.\\n`SKIP`: Represents a skipped test case.\\n`INFO`: Represents an informational log message.\\n`CONSOLE`: Represents a log that should be printed to the console.\\n`EXTENT_AND_CONSOLE`: Represents a log that should be printed to both the console and an Extent report.\\n`SCREEN_CAPTURE`: Represents a log that should include a screenshot.\\n`PASS_SCREEN_CAPTURE`: Represents a successful test case with a screenshot.\",\"/src/main/java/com/learning/listeners/TestListeners.java\":\"This file contains a single class `TestListeners` that implements the `ITestListener` and `ISuiteListener` interfaces from the TestNG framework.\\n\\n`TestListeners`: This class is responsible for handling various events during the execution of a test suite, such as the start and end of the suite, the start and end of individual tests, and the success, failure, or skipping of tests.\\n\\n`onStart(ISuite suite)`: This method is called when the test suite starts, and it initializes the Extent report.\\n\\n`onFinish(ISuite suite)`: This method is called when the test suite finishes, and it tears down the Extent report.\\n\\n`onTestStart(ITestResult result)`: This method is called when a test starts, and it creates a new Extent test, adds the author and category information, and logs the start of the test.\\n\\n`onTestSuccess(ITestResult result)`: This method is called when a test passes, and it logs the success of the test.\\n\\n`onTestFailure(ITestResult result)`: This method is called when a test fails, and it logs the failure of the test and adds the failure message to the Extent report.\\n\\n`onTestSkipped(ITestResult result)`: This method is called when a test is skipped, and it logs the skipping of the test.\"}"}
